intro: Octomeria serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated leaf octomeria, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Octomeria serratifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
